article:
The 'bicinchoninic acid assay' ('BCA assay'), also known as the 'Smith assay',
after its inventor, Paul K. Smith at the Pierce Chemical Company, is
a biochemical assay for determining the total concentration of protein in a
solution (0.5 Î¼g/mL to 1.5 mg/mL), similar to Lowry protein assay, Bradford
protein assay or biuret reagent. The total protein concentration is exhibited by
a color change of the sample solution from green to purple in proportion to
protein concentration, which can then be measured using colorimetric techniques.
